A rock star can do pretty much anything on stage and call it a â€œrock â€˜nâ€™ roll moment.â€ You can set things on fire, you can bite the head off an animal, and you can wear nothing but a sock, and everybody will love it as long as your tunes rock and you take some time to ask the crowd if theyâ€™re having a good time. The one thing you canâ€™t do, though, is disrespect the city youâ€™re playing in by getting its name wrong. You can shut your brain off and play the same songs on every night of a tour, but if you donâ€™t take five seconds to learn whether youâ€™re in Milwaukee or Madison, the crowd will turn on you in a heartbeat. 
Sadly, thatâ€™s exactly what happened to Guns Nâ€™ Roses at a recent show in Australia. As reported by the BBC , the bandâ€™s guitar technician/announcer (â€œMcBobâ€) shouted â€œSydneyâ€ as the band was taking the stage, even though they were actually in Melbourne. The BBC story notes that Guns Nâ€™ Roses also got on stage late, so this introduction was â€œmet with a chorus of boos.â€ 
The band later apologized on Twitter, explaining that this was McBobâ€™s first mistake in 30 years. Melbourne!Accidentally after 30 years McBob made an error, weâ€™re truly sorry. Thank you for coming out tonight! â€” Guns Nâ€™ Roses (@gunsnroses) February 14, 2017 
Also, to make it up to the people of Melbourne, Guns Nâ€™ Roses declared thatâ€”for that night at leastâ€”it was the real â€œParadise Cityâ€: Thanks for all the love Melbourne ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ºYou were Paradise City tonight! â€” Guns Nâ€™ Roses (@gunsnroses) February 14, 2017
